título: Price ranges filter takes only min_price for configurable products
descrição: Having a configurable product with options that cost 50, 150 and 250 and a price ranges filters in layered navigation with ranges 0-100, 100-200 and 200-300 will show the product only in the first range, as it takes min_price for the configurable product and there is no other price in ElasticSearch.

título: Frozen loop in orders page
descrição:
### Preconditions and environment

- Magento version 2.3.6
- Anything else that would help a developer reproduce the bug- sales>orders>filter by allocated sources


### Steps to reproduce

1.Logged in 
2. sales
3. orders
4. clicked on the allocated sources filter


### Expected result

I actually didn't mean to click on it so I am not sure what it would have done besides organize the orders in a specific way. 

### Actual result

 "Something went wrong with processing the default view and we have restored the filter to its original state." message and a spinning wheel that never goes away

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e0aa9d19-15ed-4c12-99bb-d616065a4473)

### Additional information

I have cleared my cache and cookies and restarted the browser and cannot get out of the spinning wheel. 

### Release note

_No response_

título: Braintree: "Client token has expired" error - Token not regenerated automatically on checkout
descrição:
### Preconditions and environment

-Magento 2 version: 2.4.7-p3
-PHP version: 8.2
-paypal/module-braintree-core version : 4.6.1-p3

-Braintree Payment Method configured with Merchant ID, Public Key, Private Key, and validated Credentials successfully.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Configure Braintree payment in Magento Admin using valid credentials.
2. Leave the site idle for more than 24 hours (token expiry period).
3. Visit the checkout page.
4. Attempt to proceed with Braintree payment.

### Expected result

- Braintree should regenerate the client token automatically if the previous one is expired.
- Checkout should load the payment method without errors.

### Actual result

Checkout displays an error:
`Either the client token has expired and a new one should be generated or the tokenization key has been deactivated or deleted.
`
Simply opening Stores > Configuration > Sales > Payment Methods in the admin temporarily resolves the issue.

### Additional information

- We have a storefront built on VueJS, checkout and admin interfaces on Magento 2.
- This issue repeats every Sunday or after site inactivity.
- Admin config visit appears to refresh the token indirectly.
- This could be related to the token lifecycle not being managed properly in Magento’s Braintree module.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1e58a7dc-884c-4aa5-9e9a-b3c1d11b3cea

### Release note

**Suggestion**
Implement a mechanism to regenerate the client token automatically when expired, especially on the checkout load.

### Triage and priority

- [x] Severity: **S0** _- Affects critical data or functionality and leaves users without workaround._
- [ ] Severity: **S1** _- Affects critical data or functionality and forces users to employ a workaround._
- [ ] Severity: **S2** _- Affects non-critical data or functionality and forces users to employ a workaround._
- [ ] Severity: **S3** _- Affects non-critical data or functionality and does not force users to employ a workaround._
- [ ] Severity: **S4** _- Affects aesthetics, professional look and feel, “quality” or “usability”._

título: 2.4.8-p1 datepicker - position is wrong on touch devices
descrição: ### Preconditions and environment - Magento version: 2.4.8-p1 ### Steps to reproduce 1. Use touch device. It can be mobile phone. Or you can use "Device preview" in Google Chrome. 2. Go to magento admin and enable "Date of Birth" field for customer (Stores -> Configuration -> Customers -> Customer Configuration -> Name and Address Options -> **Show Date of Birth = Optional**). 3. Login to customer account -> Account Information. 4. Click on "Date of Birth" field. ### Expected result Datepicker appears right above or below "Date of Birth" input field. ### Actual result Sometimes datepicker appears too far from "Date of Birth" input field. It can be even outside the visisble screen. Browser: Mobile phone: ### Additional information The issue is in file `lib/web/mage/calendar.js` method `_overwriteFindPos`. If we comment everything - it works like it should. ### Release note _No response_ ### Triage and priority - [ ] Severity: **S0** _- Affects critical data or functionality and leaves users without workaround._ - [ ] Severity: **S1** _- Affects critical data or functionality and forces users to employ a workaround._ - [ ] Severity: **S2** _- Affects non-critical data or functionality and forces users to employ a workaround._ - [x] Severity: **S3** _- Affects non-critical data or functionality and does not force users to employ a workaround._ - [ ] Severity: **S4** _- Affects aesthetics, professional look and feel, “quality” or “usability”._

descrição:

### Steps to reproduce

título: Exception thrown: 'System.InvalidOperationException' in System.Private.CoreLib.dll: 'The given ColumnMapping does not match up with any column in the source or destination.'
descrição:
Upgrading from 3.8 to 4.9 using following Environment:

1. Windows 11
2. SQL server 2008 R2 SP3
3. vscode

and have done the following:

1. pulled current developer branch
2. cloned current production store DB
3. run the 3.9 to 4.3 upgrade SQL scripts on our cloned production store DB
4. Installed and built developer branch without errors
5. start app, get install page
6. fill out install form with correct admin store credentials and raw connection string

Results are:

1. breaks on exception `Exception has occurred: CLR/System.InvalidOperationException
Exception thrown: 'System.InvalidOperationException' in System.Private.CoreLib.dll: 'The given ColumnMapping does not match up with any column in the source or destination.'
   at Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.AnalyzeTargetAndCreateUpdateBulkCommand(BulkCopySimpleResultSet internalResults)
   at Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerInternalRestContinuedAsync(BulkCopySimpleResultSet internalResults, CancellationToken cts, TaskCompletionSource`1 source)
--- End of stack trace from previous location ---
   at LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlServerBulkCopy.<>c__DisplayClass10_1`1.<<ProviderSpecificCopyInternalAsync>b__3>d.MoveNext()
   at LinqToDB.DataProvider.BasicBulkCopy.<TraceActionAsync>d__26.MoveNext()
   at LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlServerBulkCopy.<ProviderSpecificCopyInternalAsync>d__10`1.MoveNext()
   at Nop.Data.DataProviders.BaseDataProvider.<BulkInsertEntitiesAsync>d__22`1.MoveNext() in C:\Users\chris\Documents\GitHub\nopCommerce\src\Libraries\Nop.Data\DataProviders\BaseDataProvider.cs:line 391`
2. Appears to be complaining that columns in the store table do not line up 
3. confirm that store table indeed was not migrated/updated with new columns
`CREATE TABLE [dbo].[Store](
	[Id] [int] IDENTITY(1,1) NOT NULL,
	[Name] [nvarchar](400) NOT NULL,
	[Url] [nvarchar](400) NOT NULL,
	[SslEnabled] [bit] NOT NULL,
	[Hosts] [nvarchar](1000) NULL,
	[DisplayOrder] [int] NOT NULL,
	[CompanyName] [nvarchar](1000) NULL,
	[CompanyAddress] [nvarchar](1000) NULL,
	[CompanyPhoneNumber] [nvarchar](1000) NULL,
	[CompanyVat] [nvarchar](1000) NULL,
	[DefaultLanguageId] [int] NOT NULL,`
4. Confirmed that in MigrationVersionInfo table there is an entry 
`2025-07-31 13:43:42.000	Added new fields to store table	638059361410000000`
5. confirmed that there are no open transactions on the DB
`DBCC OPENTRAN;
No active open transactions.
DBCC execution completed.`

Indeed it appears that despite all the new entries of migration tasks performed in the MigrationVersionInfo table in fact NONE of them have been done.  I have to believe this is pilot error on my part but if it is seems like there should be better protections built into the app to prevent this?  How can the entries exist in the MigrationVersionInfo  table and the actual work not be done?

título: Homepage URL doesn't have "/en" when "SEO friendly URLs with multiple languages" setting is enabled
descrição:
Step to reproduce:
1. Create multiple languages. One of them should be "English"
2.  Ensure "SEO friendly URLs with multiple languages" setting is enabled
3. Go to any page. The home page URL (a logo in the top left corder) should contain language prefix. It exists for all languages except "English"


See: Nop.Web\Infrastructure\BaseRouteProvider.cs

título: MySQL Container Fails: Identifier name too long in Docker Compose Setup
descrição:
### Problem Description

I'm trying to run a nopCommerce + MySQL setup using Docker Compose on macOS (Macbook Air - M2 - Arm64). During container startup, MySQL fails with this error:

Setup failed: Identifier name 'FK_CustomerAttributeValue_CustomerAttributeId_CustomerAttribute_Id' is too long

### Environment

- Docker Desktop (macOS)
- MySQL 8.0
- nopCommerce with EF Core

### mysql-docker-compose.yml (partial)

```yaml
services:
  nopcommerce_web:
    build: .
    container_name: nopcommerce
    ports:
      - "80:80"
    depends_on:
      - nopcommerce_database

  nopcommerce_database:
    image: mysql:8.0
    container_name: nopcommerce_mysql_server
    restart: always
    environment:
      MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: root
      MYSQL_DATABASE: mydb
      MYSQL_USER: nopuser
      MYSQL_PASSWORD: nop123
    volumes:
      - nopcommerce_data:/var/lib/mysql

volumes:
  nopcommerce_data:

What I Tried
 - Switched to MySQL 8.0 (And also I tired with MySQL Latest but it didn't work)

 - Simplified the constraint name manually (but not sure where to modify it in EF Core)

 - Verified MySQL is up, but schema fails on setup due to long foreign key names

Help Needed
 - How to override EF Core to use shorter constraint names?

 - Or how to configure MySQL for longer identifiers if possible?

Thanks in advance!
Arun

título: Bulk edit products. Editing products without SKU
descrição:
Version: nopCommerce 4.80.X

From the bulk edit grid, when a product is set with no SKU and any field is edited and click "Save all" button, it throws the following error:
"System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object."
The expected behavior should be that the edited field is updated, or if there is any validation issue, a warning message should be displayed instead of throwing an error.
Please find the reference screenshot attached.
1. https://prnt.sc/bVOFBygYbiOh
2. https://prnt.sc/Jyo5pygz468o
3. https://prnt.sc/5s0DzIvaZ9GR

Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to  nopCommerce Admin >> Catalog >> Products >> Bulk Edit Products
2. Make any product’s SKU field empty and edit any field of that product
3. Click the Save All button

Forum source: https://www.nopcommerce.com/en/boards/topic/102359/bulk-edit-products-edit-and-save-issue-in-480


It will also happen if you just select the one record having no SKU and "Save selected".

título: Item removal handler conflicting with coupon removal button in shopping cart
descrição:
**What version of OpenCart are you reporting this for?**
4.1.0.3

**Describe the bug**
When viewing the shopping cart, users are able to add coupons, but are not able to remove them. After the coupon removal button exits the "loading" status, nothing appears to the user. When inspecting the behavior via the browser dev tools, the actual network request is made to `?route=checkout/cart&language=en-gb`. The coupon's removal button has `formaction="...?route=extension/opencart/checkout/coupon.remove&language=en-gb"`, so obviously there's an issue here.

Upon further investigation, the issue seems to be that the shopping cart handler for removing products has too broad of a scope, and is catching the event when the coupon removal button is clicked. This is because the coupon stuff is rendered inside the `#shopping-cart` element, and since the removal button has the `.btn-danger` class, and because the shopping cart handler for removing products is applied later than the expected handler in `common.js`, it ultimately undesirably handles the click.

Handler for removing products:
https://github.com/opencart/opencart/blob/90dcdfa7503ada4dbfcf41d92b14af36e57b21fd/upload/catalog/view/template/checkout/cart.twig#L66

Coupon removal button:
https://github.com/opencart/opencart/blob/90dcdfa7503ada4dbfcf41d92b14af36e57b21fd/upload/extension/opencart/catalog/view/template/checkout/coupon.twig#L15

Intended handler:
https://github.com/opencart/opencart/blob/90dcdfa7503ada4dbfcf41d92b14af36e57b21fd/upload/catalog/view/javascript/common.js#L118

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Add any product to the shopping cart
2. View the shopping cart
3. Add a coupon
4. Click the button to remove the coupon

**Expected behavior**
The coupon should be removed, and the user should recieve a success alert.

**Server / Test environment:**
 - Local development on the host (no Docker)
 - Linux Mint 22.1
 - PHP 8.3.23
 - Brave 1.80.115 (Chromium: 138.0.7204.97)

**Suggested Resolution:**
As far as I can tell, there's two approaches to fix it. I'm willing to do a PR for the fix, but wanted some feedback from others first. Both fixes would be in `cart.twig`.
1. Change the handler scope to use `#output-cart` instead of `#shopping-cart`.
2. Add a dedicated class to the product removal `<a>` elements (e.g. `.remove-item`) and update the handler's selector to use that class instead of `.btn-danger`.

título: probleme-with-php-8.2-in Prestashop-8.2
descrição:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I understand and accept the project's [code of conduct](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/blob/develop/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
- [x] I have already [searched in existing issues](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3ABug) and found no previous report of this bug.

### Describe the bug and add attachments

I upgraded my project from version 8.1 to 8.2, and I'm in an environment that uses PHP 8.2, but my PrestaShop 8.2 website no longer works, and I no longer have access to the administration interface.

<!-- Failed to upload "WhatsApp Image 2025-07-31 à 12.42.42_d0b68e91.jpg" -->

### Expected behavior

In principle, given that PrestaShop 8.2 supports PHP 8.2, my website should display correctly, and I should have access to the back office without any issues.

### Steps to reproduce

Access to the website

Connection / Login

Authentication

White page / Blank page

### PrestaShop version(s) where the bug happened

8.2

### How you installed PrestaShop

download package

### PHP version(s) where the bug happened

8.2

título: Prestashop Minimal product quantity
descrição: ### Prerequisites - [x] I understand and accept the project's [code of conduct](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/blob/develop/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). - [x] I have already [searched in existing issues](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3ABug) and found no previous report of this bug. --- ### Describe the bug and add attachments > ❗️Note: This issue occurs **even if the theme is not the Classic theme**. > However, the bug is **not caused by the theme itself**, but by the logic of how "Add to cart" is handled in product listings when combinations and minimal quantity are involved. When a product has **combinations** and a **minimal purchase quantity** (e.g. 3), the **product listings view** (category pages, home, featured products, etc.) always assumes a quantity of 1. If the user clicks "Add to cart" from the product list/card (not from the product detail page), nothing happens, and there is no error shown. This results in broken UX and lost sales opportunities. 📸 Screenshots: --- ### Expected behavior The product card should either: - Display the correct minimal quantity, or - Redirect the user to the product page to select a valid combination. If "Add to cart" is available directly in the listing, it should respect the minimal quantity set for the default combination. A proper error message should appear if the quantity is too low. --- ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create a product with combinations (e.g. Size: S, M, L). 2. Set the default combination’s minimal quantity to 3. 3. Place this product in a category or home listing. 4. From the product listing, click "Add to cart" without visiting the product page. 5. The product is not added, and no message is shown. --- ### PrestaShop version(s) where the bug happened 8.1.2 --- ### How you installed PrestaShop _No response_ --- ### PHP version(s) where the bug happened _No response_ --- ### If your bug is related to a module, specify its name and its version _No response_ --- ### Additional context We are aware that combination handling in product listings is limited by design, but when minimal quantity is enforced and "Add to cart" is visible, the system should not fail silently. A safe fallback would be to disable direct cart actions for combination products with constraints, or force redirect to the product page when required. The current behavior can mislead the customer into thinking the site is broken. Would you accept a contribution (PR) that disables or redirects the button in these cases?

título: Product Description overwriting HTML Code
descrição:
### Shopware Version

6.7.1.0

### Affected area / extension

Extension:Commercial

### Actual behaviour

When writing HTML with inline CSS in the product description using the HTML mode, it's possible to create well-formatted and styled layouts.

However, as soon as you switch back to the Standard Editor and make even a small change (e.g. editing a single word), the editor automatically rewrites and strips parts of the custom HTML/CSS code.

Expected Behavior:
The WYSIWYG editor should preserve valid HTML/CSS code written manually in HTML mode, even after switching to or editing within the standard visual editor.

Actual Behavior:
Switching to the Standard Editor and editing content results in:

Inline styles being removed or altered

Custom HTML structure (e.g. <table>, <colgroup>, or styled <td>) being replaced or simplified

Loss of layout integrity

Steps to Reproduce:

Open the product description in HTML mode.

Add a styled HTML block with inline CSS (e.g. table with cell padding or background colors).

Save and switch to the Standard Editor.

Make a small change, like editing a word.

Save again and reopen in HTML mode → custom styles are gone.

Impact:
This behavior makes it difficult or impossible to maintain advanced HTML-based layouts in product descriptions.

### Expected behaviour

If i switch Between HTML to standard Editor side and i write text it shouldt overwrite anything.

### How to reproduce

make a table in the Editor. Go to the html code Editor and change the Table with css. Switch to the standard editor sight and change a word. Save and reload the Website.

### Definition of Done

- [ ] An automated test covers the fix.
- [ ] Integration/E2E testing in staging is done.
- [ ] Changelog markdown file created or updated in /changelog/_unreleased directory.
- [ ] Developer documentation written/updated.
- [ ] End user and/or developer documentation written or updated with clarification.
- [ ] Regression test created to ensure bug does not reappear, and automated regression tests pass.
- [ ] Code changes resolve the reported bug without introducing new issues.

título: Squished line item document text
descrição:
### Shopware Version

6.7.1

### Affected area / extension

Platform(Default)

### Actual behaviour

The line item list in an document is currently squished to the left side of the document.

[Invoice_with_error.pdf](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21502946/Invoice_with_error.pdf)

### Expected behaviour

The listing should be dsplayed over the full width.

[Invoice_without_error.pdf](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21502953/Invoice_without_error.pdf)

### How to reproduce

Create a standard invoice document.

título: problem in woocommerce at the end of shipping
descrição:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I have carried out troubleshooting steps and I believe I have found a bug.
- [ ] I have searched for similar bugs in both open and closed issues and cannot find a duplicate.

### Describe the bug

at the end of the cart when doing the shipping in our website there is a problem that not allow the client see the order completed, in spite the order is created 2 or 3 times

### Expected behavior

the correct behaviour is that the client see a window who says that the order is completed

### Actual behavior

client do the shipment and when finishing the order it appear an error window

### Steps to reproduce

1. go to https://carnivalmeatlab.com/tienda/
2. add items to cart
3. go to finish order
4. fulfill the client info
5. finish your order
6. window of error appear

título: Mark the ‘Set up payments’ task as in progress on WooCommerce Home when live WooPayments onboarding started
descrição:
Currently, the **“Set up payments”** task on the WooCommerce Home screen is not updated to reflect progress when a merchant begins live WooPayments onboarding. As a result, the task may remain in its initial state, even though the onboarding process is already underway.

### **Expected Behavior**

When a merchant initiates **live onboarding** for WooPayments, the “Set up payments” task should automatically transition to the **“in progress”** state.

### **Actual Behavior**

The task remains in its default (not started) state, even after live onboarding is started, potentially confusing merchants or giving the impression that no progress has been made.

título: [Payments NOX] Store in subdirectory can't switch to live through NOX flow
descrição:
## **Describe the bug**

The URL used to disable the current WooPayments test account (`/wp-json/wc-admin/settings/payments/woopayments/onboarding/test_account/disable`) is incorrect for stores installed in a subdirectory (`example.com/store/`). This causes the test account to not be disabled when users click on "Activate payments" on the Payments Settings page.

## **To Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

* Install WordPress in a subdirectory
* Install WooCommerce and onboard a test account with WooPayments via the WooCommerce > Settings > Payments page.
* Go to WooCommerce > Settings > Payments and click on "Activate payments" and notice that nothing happens (and that there is a 404 fetch POST request in the Network browser logs)

## **Expected behavior**

"Activate payments" should work.

## **Screenshots**

## Environment

título: Add REST API and hooks documentations to repository
descrição:
On the conversation with @nerrad on [https://wooorderstatusp2.wordpress.com/2025/07/30/woocommerce-order-fulfillments-complete-hooks-reference/#comment-297](https://wooorderstatusp2.wordpress.com/2025/07/30/woocommerce-order-fulfillments-complete-hooks-reference/#comment-297) we decided to include the fulfillments REST API and hooks documentation to WooCommerce public repository, because:

* It’s early documentation that lives close to the code being documented.
* If testing end us surfacing any changes being made, the docs can (and should) be updated in the same PR.

título: The editor is not showing previewCart data for the checkout blocks
descrição: When the admin doesn't have a cart session, or a cart already saved in localStorage the Editor pages for the checkout blocks fail to display the preview cart ## **Describe the bug** When the admin doesn't have a cart session, or a cart already saved in localStorage the Editor pages for the checkout blocks fail to display the preview cart ## **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Log in as an admin in incognito. Make sure you have no cart in the storefront, or a cached cart in LocalStorage 2. Go to the Site Editor > Templates > WooCommerce > Page: Cart or Page: Checkout 3. Notice the missing cart items and data ## **Expected behavior** A preview cart should be rendered with the Beanie and Cap products ## **Screenshots** ## Environment Please fill out any of the below that applies **Operating System/Device** - [ ] Windows - [ ] MacOS - [ ] Linux - [ ] iPhone - [ ] Samsung - [ ] Other (add in additional context field) **Version:** **Browser** - [ ] Desktop Edge - [ ] Desktop Chrome/Chromium - [ ] Desktop Safari - [ ] Mobile Edge - [ ] Mobile Chrome/Chromium - [ ] Mobile Safari - [ ] Other (add in additional context field) **Version:** ## **Additional context**
